trans-unit.source: This article describes how to send a local tile notification to a primary tile and a secondary tile using adaptive tile templates.
trans-unit.target: This article describes how to send a local tile notification to a primary tile and a secondary tile using adaptive tile templates.

trans-unit.source: Send a local tile notification
trans-unit.target: Send a local tile notification

trans-unit.source: Send a local tile notification
trans-unit.target: Send a local tile notification

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: Primary app tiles in Windows 10 are defined in your app manifest, while secondary tiles are programmatically created and defined by your app code.
trans-unit.target: Primary app tiles in Windows 10 are defined in your app manifest, while secondary tiles are programmatically created and defined by your app code.

trans-unit.source: This article describes how to send a local tile notification to a primary tile and a secondary tile using adaptive tile templates.
trans-unit.target: This article describes how to send a local tile notification to a primary tile and a secondary tile using adaptive tile templates.

trans-unit.source: (A local notification is one that's sent from app code as opposed to one that's pushed or pulled from a web server.)
trans-unit.target: (A local notification is one that's sent from app code as opposed to one that's pushed or pulled from a web server.)

trans-unit.source: default tile and tile with notification
trans-unit.target: default tile and tile with notification

trans-unit.source: **Note** Learn about [creating adaptive tiles](tiles-and-notifications-create-adaptive-tiles.md) and [adaptive tile template schema](tiles-and-notifications-adaptive-tiles-schema.md).
trans-unit.target: **Note** Learn about [creating adaptive tiles](tiles-and-notifications-create-adaptive-tiles.md) and [adaptive tile template schema](tiles-and-notifications-adaptive-tiles-schema.md).

trans-unit.source: Install the NuGet package
trans-unit.target: Install the NuGet package

trans-unit.source: We recommend installing the [NotificationsExtensions NuGet package](https://www.nuget.org/packages/NotificationsExtensions.Win10/), which simplifies things by generating tile payloads with objects instead of raw XML.
trans-unit.target: We recommend installing the [NotificationsExtensions NuGet package](https://www.nuget.org/packages/NotificationsExtensions.Win10/), which simplifies things by generating tile payloads with objects instead of raw XML.

trans-unit.source: The inline code examples in this article are for C# with the [NotificationsExtensions](https://github.com/WindowsNotifications/NotificationsExtensions/wiki) NuGet package installed.
trans-unit.target: The inline code examples in this article are for C# with the [NotificationsExtensions](https://github.com/WindowsNotifications/NotificationsExtensions/wiki) NuGet package installed.

trans-unit.source: (If you'd prefer to create your own XML, you can find code examples without [NotificationsExtensions](https://github.com/WindowsNotifications/NotificationsExtensions/wiki) toward the end of the article.)
trans-unit.target: (If you'd prefer to create your own XML, you can find code examples without [NotificationsExtensions](https://github.com/WindowsNotifications/NotificationsExtensions/wiki) toward the end of the article.)

trans-unit.source: Add namespace declarations
trans-unit.target: Add namespace declarations

trans-unit.source: To access the tile APIs, include the [**Windows.UI.Notifications**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208661) namespace.
trans-unit.target: To access the tile APIs, include the [**Windows.UI.Notifications**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208661) namespace.

trans-unit.source: We also recommend including the **NotificationsExtensions.Tiles** namespace so that you can take advantage of our tile helper APIs (you must install the [NotificationsExtensions](https://github.com/WindowsNotifications/NotificationsExtensions/wiki) NuGet package to access these APIs).
trans-unit.target: We also recommend including the **NotificationsExtensions.Tiles** namespace so that you can take advantage of our tile helper APIs (you must install the [NotificationsExtensions](https://github.com/WindowsNotifications/NotificationsExtensions/wiki) NuGet package to access these APIs).

trans-unit.source: Create the notification content
trans-unit.target: Create the notification content

trans-unit.source: In Windows 10, tile payloads are defined using adaptive tile templates, which allow you to create custom visual layouts for your notifications.
trans-unit.target: In Windows 10, tile payloads are defined using adaptive tile templates, which allow you to create custom visual layouts for your notifications.

trans-unit.source: (To learn what's possible with adaptive tiles, see the [Create adaptive tiles](tiles-and-notifications-create-adaptive-tiles.md) and [Adaptive tile templates](tiles-and-notifications-adaptive-tiles-schema.md) articles.)
trans-unit.target: (To learn what's possible with adaptive tiles, see the [Create adaptive tiles](tiles-and-notifications-create-adaptive-tiles.md) and [Adaptive tile templates](tiles-and-notifications-adaptive-tiles-schema.md) articles.)

trans-unit.source: This code example creates adaptive tile content for medium and wide tiles.
trans-unit.target: This code example creates adaptive tile content for medium and wide tiles.

trans-unit.source: The notification content looks like the following when displayed on a medium tile:
trans-unit.target: The notification content looks like the following when displayed on a medium tile:

trans-unit.source: notification content on a medium tile
trans-unit.target: notification content on a medium tile

trans-unit.source: Create the notification
trans-unit.target: Create the notification

trans-unit.source: Once you have your notification content, you'll need to create a new [**TileNotification**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208616).
trans-unit.target: Once you have your notification content, you'll need to create a new [**TileNotification**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208616).

trans-unit.source: The **TileNotification** constructor takes a Windows Runtime [**XmlDocument**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208620) object, which you can obtain from the **TileContent.GetXml** method if you're using [NotificationsExtensions](https://github.com/WindowsNotifications/NotificationsExtensions/wiki).
trans-unit.target: The **TileNotification** constructor takes a Windows Runtime [**XmlDocument**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208620) object, which you can obtain from the **TileContent.GetXml** method if you're using [NotificationsExtensions](https://github.com/WindowsNotifications/NotificationsExtensions/wiki).

trans-unit.source: This code example creates a notification for a new tile.
trans-unit.target: This code example creates a notification for a new tile.

trans-unit.source: Set an expiration time for the notification (optional)
trans-unit.target: Set an expiration time for the notification (optional)

trans-unit.source: By default, local tile and badge notifications don't expire, while push, periodic, and scheduled notifications expire after three days.
trans-unit.target: By default, local tile and badge notifications don't expire, while push, periodic, and scheduled notifications expire after three days.

trans-unit.source: Because tile content shouldn't persist longer than necessary, it's a best practice to set an expiration time that makes sense for your app, especially on local tile and badge notifications.
trans-unit.target: Because tile content shouldn't persist longer than necessary, it's a best practice to set an expiration time that makes sense for your app, especially on local tile and badge notifications.

trans-unit.source: This code example creates a notification that expires and will be removed from the tile after ten minutes.
trans-unit.target: This code example creates a notification that expires and will be removed from the tile after ten minutes.

trans-unit.source: Send the notification
trans-unit.target: Send the notification

trans-unit.source: Although locally sending a tile notification is simple, sending the notification to a primary or secondary tile is a bit different.
trans-unit.target: Although locally sending a tile notification is simple, sending the notification to a primary or secondary tile is a bit different.

trans-unit.source: Primary tile
trans-unit.target: Primary tile

trans-unit.source: To send a notification to a primary tile, use the [**TileUpdateManager**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208622) to create a tile updater for the primary tile, and send the notification by calling "Update".
trans-unit.target: To send a notification to a primary tile, use the [**TileUpdateManager**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208622) to create a tile updater for the primary tile, and send the notification by calling "Update".

trans-unit.source: Regardless of whether it's visible, your app's primary tile always exists, so you can send notifications to it even when it's not pinned.
trans-unit.target: Regardless of whether it's visible, your app's primary tile always exists, so you can send notifications to it even when it's not pinned.

trans-unit.source: If the user pins your primary tile later, the notifications that you sent will appear then.
trans-unit.target: If the user pins your primary tile later, the notifications that you sent will appear then.

trans-unit.source: This code example sends a notification to a primary tile.
trans-unit.target: This code example sends a notification to a primary tile.

trans-unit.source: Secondary tile
trans-unit.target: Secondary tile

trans-unit.source: To send a notification to a secondary tile, first make sure that the secondary tile exists.
trans-unit.target: To send a notification to a secondary tile, first make sure that the secondary tile exists.

trans-unit.source: If you try to create a tile updater for a secondary tile that doesn't exist (for example, if the user unpinned the secondary tile), an exception will be thrown.
trans-unit.target: If you try to create a tile updater for a secondary tile that doesn't exist (for example, if the user unpinned the secondary tile), an exception will be thrown.

trans-unit.source: You can use [**SecondaryTile.Exists**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242205)(tileId) to discover if your secondary tile is pinned, and then create a tile updater for the secondary tile and send the notification.
trans-unit.target: You can use [**SecondaryTile.Exists**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242205)(tileId) to discover if your secondary tile is pinned, and then create a tile updater for the secondary tile and send the notification.

trans-unit.source: This code example sends a notification to a secondary tile.
trans-unit.target: This code example sends a notification to a secondary tile.

trans-unit.source: default tile and tile with notification
trans-unit.target: default tile and tile with notification

trans-unit.source: Clear notifications on the tile (optional)
trans-unit.target: Clear notifications on the tile (optional)

trans-unit.source: In most cases, you should clear a notification once the user has interacted with that content.
trans-unit.target: In most cases, you should clear a notification once the user has interacted with that content.

trans-unit.source: For example, when the user launches your app, you might want to clear all the notifications from the tile.
trans-unit.target: For example, when the user launches your app, you might want to clear all the notifications from the tile.

trans-unit.source: If your notifications are time-bound, we recommend that you set an expiration time on the notification instead of explicitly clearing the notification.
trans-unit.target: If your notifications are time-bound, we recommend that you set an expiration time on the notification instead of explicitly clearing the notification.

trans-unit.source: This code example clears the tile notification.
trans-unit.target: This code example clears the tile notification.

trans-unit.source: For a tile with the notification queue enabled and notifications in the queue, calling the Clear method empties the queue.
trans-unit.target: For a tile with the notification queue enabled and notifications in the queue, calling the Clear method empties the queue.

trans-unit.source: You can't, however, clear a notification via your app's server; only the local app code can clear notifications.
trans-unit.target: You can't, however, clear a notification via your app's server; only the local app code can clear notifications.

trans-unit.source: Periodic or push notifications can only add new notifications or replace existing notifications.
trans-unit.target: Periodic or push notifications can only add new notifications or replace existing notifications.

trans-unit.source: A local call to the Clear method will clear the tile whether or not the notifications themselves came via push, periodic, or local.
trans-unit.target: A local call to the Clear method will clear the tile whether or not the notifications themselves came via push, periodic, or local.

trans-unit.source: Scheduled notifications that haven't yet appeared are not cleared by this method.
trans-unit.target: Scheduled notifications that haven't yet appeared are not cleared by this method.

trans-unit.source: tile with notification and tile after being cleared
trans-unit.target: tile with notification and tile after being cleared

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Using the notification queue
trans-unit.target: Using the notification queue

trans-unit.source: Now that you have done your first tile update, you can expand the functionality of the tile by enabling a [notification queue](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh868234).
trans-unit.target: Now that you have done your first tile update, you can expand the functionality of the tile by enabling a [notification queue](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh868234).

trans-unit.source: Other notification delivery methods
trans-unit.target: Other notification delivery methods

trans-unit.source: This article shows you how to send the tile update as a notification.
trans-unit.target: This article shows you how to send the tile update as a notification.

trans-unit.source: To explore other methods of notification delivery, including scheduled, periodic, and push, see [Delivering notifications](tiles-and-notifications-choosing-a-notification-delivery-method.md).
trans-unit.target: To explore other methods of notification delivery, including scheduled, periodic, and push, see [Delivering notifications](tiles-and-notifications-choosing-a-notification-delivery-method.md).

trans-unit.source: XmlEncode delivery method
trans-unit.target: XmlEncode delivery method

trans-unit.source: If you're not using [NotificationsExtensions](https://github.com/WindowsNotifications/NotificationsExtensions/wiki), this notification delivery method is another alternative.
trans-unit.target: If you're not using [NotificationsExtensions](https://github.com/WindowsNotifications/NotificationsExtensions/wiki), this notification delivery method is another alternative.

trans-unit.source: Code examples without NotificationsExtensions
trans-unit.target: Code examples without NotificationsExtensions

trans-unit.source: If you prefer to work with raw XML instead of the [NotificationsExtensions](https://github.com/WindowsNotifications/NotificationsExtensions/wiki) NuGet package, use these alternate code examples to first three examples provided in this article.
trans-unit.target: If you prefer to work with raw XML instead of the [NotificationsExtensions](https://github.com/WindowsNotifications/NotificationsExtensions/wiki) NuGet package, use these alternate code examples to first three examples provided in this article.

trans-unit.source: The rest of the code examples can be used either with [NotificationsExtensions](https://github.com/WindowsNotifications/NotificationsExtensions/wiki) or with raw XML.
trans-unit.target: The rest of the code examples can be used either with [NotificationsExtensions](https://github.com/WindowsNotifications/NotificationsExtensions/wiki) or with raw XML.
